newsitem.title: USA: Worldtex sees higher Q4 profits.
newsitem.headline: Worldtex sees higher Q4 profits.

text.p: Worldtex Inc said on Tuesday that it expects fourth quarter profits to significantly exceed those of last year's fourth quarter and its full year profits to meet or exceed analysts' estimates.
In last year's fourth quarter, the company reported profits of $359,000, or $0.02 a share.
Last year, the company reported 1995 profits of $5.25 million, or $0.36 a share.
Analysts expect Worldtex to earn between $0.70 and $0.75 a share, Worldtex said.

Worldtex said its low cost manufacturing facility in Coolmbia continues to help the company improve margins and sales and profits in North America posted increases in the third quarter this year, reversing a trend.
The company supplies customers with covered elastic yarn containing nylon, cotton and microfibers, Worldtex said.
